In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

You can create the `timezone_bumper` function in Julia as follows:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end

function timezone_bumper(dt::Date, bump::Int=3)
    throw(ArgumentError("Function only supports DateTime types"))
end
```

This function checks the type of the input parameter `dt` and throws an error if the input is of type `Date`. If the input is of type `DateTime`, it will add the specified number of hours to the timestamp.
